title: Everett 7th grader arrested by ICE had a gun, knife on him, feds say
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News “Here are the facts: he posed a public safety threat with an extensive rap sheet,” a Department of Homeland Security official alleged.
Yuki Iwamura/AP Photo By Abby Patkin October 14, 2025 | 3:29 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A 13-year-old Everett boy arrested by Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents last week had a gun and a knife on him when apprehended, a Department of Homeland Security official claimed Monday.

title: NBA analyst explained why he’s ‘more excited to watch the Celtics this year than last year’
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics "Is that crazy to say?
" Celtics pregame before playing the Cavaliers in preseason on Sunday (Michael Dwyer/AP Photo).
The Celtics have gotten used to contending and winning in recent years.

title: Boston travelers can now de-stress with dogs at Logan Airport
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel "BOS PAWS" is a new therapy dog program at Logan.
Waffles, a trained therapy dog, stops to greet passengers at Logan airport on Friday.
Christopher Muther Air travel can be stressful.

title: These were the Mass. rainfall totals for this week’s nor’easter
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Weather Some areas of the Bay State received up to 6 inches of rain this week.
Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe Massachusetts saw a lot of rain from this week’s nor’easter.
The rain started on Thursday and continued into Tuesday.

title: A major biomanufacturer is cutting over 100 jobs in Mass.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business Revvity said it will lay off employees in Boston and Lawrence as it consolidates operations.
Revvity, formerly known as PerkinElmer, moved into a new headquarters in Waltham in 2024.
Handout Biomanufacturer Revvity Inc.

title: Al Horford explained why he decided to leave the Celtics
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Boston Celtics "They just weren’t in a position to offer me the opportunity that I wanted.
" Al Horford at a press conference after signing with the Warriors.

AP Photo/Jeff Chiu By Hayden Bird October 14, 2025 | 2:06 PM 2 minutes to read Even in an offseason of high-profile player departures, the exit of Al Horford stuck out as a major loss for the Celtics.

title: Elin Hilderbrand’s new book ‘The Academy’ already has a TV adaptation in the works
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Books Ahead of her Boston Book Fest appearance, Elin Hilderbrand announces new novel with daughter Shelby Cunningham, multiple screen adaptations — and her final book tour.
Elin Hilderbrand and daughter Shelby Cunningham talk their new Massachusetts-set page-turner "The Academy.

title: NFL insider suggests the Patriots trade for this rival team’s running back
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: New England Patriots ESPN's Mike Reiss writes that the Jets' Breece Hall could be an interesting trade target for the Patriots, should New York be open to moving him.
Breece Hall against the Patriots in 2024 (Matthew J.

title: Local police warn TikTokers against pulling ‘AI homeless man prank’
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Technology The viral trend uses AI-generated images to trick people into believing there’s an intruder in their home.
The TikTok app page in the Apple App store on a smartphone.

Gabby Jones/Bloomberg By Abby Patkin October 14, 2025 | 1:20 PM 1 minute to read Salem police are warning pranksters against a “stupid and potentially dangerous” social media trend that uses AI-generated images of a disheveled stranger to trick people into believing there’s an intruder in their home.

title: South Shore police dept. issues warning after video shows self-driving car blowing past school bus
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Drivers are still responsible for the vehicle's operation while in self-driving mode, Hingham police said.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
The Hingham Police Department issued a warning about self-driving cars after a Tesla was caught on video blowing past a school bus in the South Shore community.
